title: Two-time heavyweight champ Foreman dies at 76
content: George Foreman, a two-time heavyweight champion, Olympic gold medalist and Hall of Fame boxer, died Friday at age 76.

title: Sources: Winston joining Giants for 2 years, $8M
content: Free-agent quarterback Jameis Winston announced Friday that he has agreed to sign with the New York Giants.

title: UConn's 'amazing run' alive after record-tying win
content: Friday night's win was UConn's 13th straight in the tournament, tied with the 1991-93 Duke Blue Devils for the longest streak since the tournament expanded in 1985.

title: Flagg (ankle) comes out of Duke win fully healthy
content: Cooper Flagg had 14 points, 7 rebounds, 4 assists and 2 blocks in about 22 minutes for Duke on Friday, later saying his ankle was no worse for the wear.

title: Calipari, Pitino not close but share 'great' respect
content: Rick Pitino and John Calipari again will be in the spotlight when St. John's takes on Arkansas on Saturday. It's a relationship rooted in respect, even though the coaching greats acknowledge they're not close.

title: Hamilton wins China GP sprint for 1st Ferrari win
content: Lewis Hamilton took his first win as a Ferrari driver after securing a lights-to-flag victory in the sprint race at the Chinese Grand Prix.

title: Ingles given rare start; autistic son able to watch
content: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch gave Joe Ingles his first start since January 2022 on Friday night, allowing his autistic son Jacob the chance to see him play.

title: 'Diversity' off MLB careers page after exec order
content: Major League Baseball has taken references to diversity off its careers page as it evaluates programs in light of an executive order.

title: A&M's Williams addresses 'dangerous' online hate
content: Texas A&M guard Jace Carter says he has been the target of death threats and racial slurs on social media this season.

title: Men's March Madness Day 2 guide: Results, analysis, keys to second round
content: Whether you missed the action or simply want to relive it, here's a rundown of all 16 games from Friday.

title: Women's March Madness Day 1 guide: Analysis and recaps of all 16 games
content: From blowouts to one double-digit seed advancing, we break down all Friday's chalky opening to women's March Madness.

title: 38 names to know for next year’s NFL free agent class: Who could end up available and get paid?
content: Who are the top names to know for next year's NFL free agency? Here's our list of who might be available and has a chance to get paid.

title: Two years after losing the Texas job, Chris Beard right at home at Ole Miss
content: The university and the city of Oxford have welcomed the coach as he rebuilds the men's basketball team.

title: Next stop, Tampa: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: From All-Star to architect: How Buster Posey plans to rebuild the Giants
content: The future Hall of Fame catcher turned president of baseball operations has a vision to bring baseball glory back to San Francisco.

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Panama made it three straight victories over the U.S. in tournament play as Mauricio Pochettino's side slumped to a 1-0 defeat in the Concacaf Nations League semifinal that showed the Americans at their worst.

title: Almada golazo gives win to Messi-less Argentina
content: Argentina didn't miss Lionel Messi, Lautaro Martínez and other key players on Friday and beat Uruguay away 1-0 in convincing fashion in their South American World Cup qualifying match.

title: 'You're my idol': Henry joins Panama celebrations
content: Panama's Cecilio Waterman celebrated one of the biggest goals in his country's history, to defeat the USMNT, with his idol Thierry Henry.

title: Leon kicked out of Club World Cup by FIFA
content: Grupo Pachuca confirmed that the FIFA appeals committee on Friday ruled Club León out of participation in the 2025 Club World Cup due to the tournament's multi-ownership rules.

title: Lewis-Skelly sets England record with debut goal
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly made history on Friday by becoming the youngest player to score on his senior debut for England when he found the back of the net in the Three Lions' victory over Albania at Wembley Stadium.

title: Wood carded for signing autographs in NZ win
content: Chris Wood picked up a yellow card for signing autographs and taking pictures with fans during New Zealand's win over Fiji in their World Cup qualifier on Thursday.

title: Salah scores in Egypt World Cup qualifying win
content: Captain Mohamed Salah scored for Egypt as they eased to a 2-0 victory over Ethiopia in their 2026 World Cup qualifier on Friday, but 2022 semi-finalists Morocco needed a late winner from Bilal El Khannouss to defeat unfancied Niger.

title: Disgruntled Poch: Wearing U.S. shirt 'not enough'
content: Mauricio Pochettino was left visibly frustrated after the USMNT's shocking 1-0 defeat to Panama in the Concacaf Nations League, bluntly telling his players it was not enough to just simply show up in the national team shirt and expect to win.

title: Alisson set for Liverpool return after concussion
content: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson Becker has withdrawn from the Brazil squad after sustaining a concussion during Thursday's World Cup qualifier with Colombia.

title: Your guide to March Madness Day 1: Recaps, every winner's chance to advance, more
content: Whether you missed the action or simply want to relive it, here's a rundown of all 16 games from Thursday.

title: From Dunk City to Rupp's Runts: Maryland's Crab Five the latest iconic CBB squad nickname
content: College basketball has produced many memorable squad nicknames over the years. Maryland's "Crab Five" is the latest.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: MMA madness: 16 welterweights go head-to-head
content: Is your hoops bracket already busted? Welcome to MMA madness, where predictions -- and upsets -- abound!

title: Real or not: Fundora undisputed, Boots will unify, and Ryan will solve Mayer in rematch
content: Our experts discuss notable upcoming fights, Keith Thurman's return, the next American heavyweight and more.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: Forecaster for Week 1: March 27-30
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster preview, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Early contenders and who can't be ruled out just yet
content: A month into the MLS season, whose play has put them into early contention for MVP? And which preseason favorites shouldn't be written off yet?

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan to drop Leao's release clause, Chelsea interested
content: AC Milan are willing to discount Rafael Leao's release clause, and Chelsea could land him. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Is the 2025 field the most talented NASCAR has ever seen?
content: Twenty-five drivers in the 2025 NASCAR field have won Cup Series races, making it arguably the deepest ever.

title: 'Rioters will pay for damages, bulldozers will be used if ...': CM Fadnavis on Nagpur violence
content: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis reviewed the communal violence in Nagpur due to the Aurangzeb tomb row. He emphasized that rioters would bear the costs of damages, with assets sold if necessary. The unrest included stone-pelting after rumors of a Quran verse burning. Over 100 arrests have been made, and social media posts inciting violence have been deleted.

title: Amid fair delimitation push, a ‘Sword of Damocles’ warning from Kerala CM
content: Tamil Nadu's DMK-led Joint Action Committee meeting, chaired by CM M.K. Stalin, united multiple state leaders against population-based Lok Sabha delimitation. They argue this move threatens democratic representation, particularly for southern states that have successfully implemented population control measures.

title: Muskan Rastogi celebrated birthday, Holi with lover days after husband's murder
content: Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla, after murdering Muskaan's husband Saurabh, were seen celebrating Holi and Muskaan's birthday. The case, involving Saurabh's disappearance and subsequent discovery of his decomposed body, unfolded that Muskaan had manipulated Sahil. Both have been charged with murder. Muskaan's parents demand strict punishment, citing her as a danger to society.

title: ‘Met his priest’: Putin 'prayed' for Trump after shooting, top US envoy reveals
content: Following an assassination attempt on Donald Trump, Russian President Vladimir Putin visited his church to pray for Trump and demonstrated goodwill through personal gestures. Steve Witkoff highlighted Trump's approach to diplomatic engagement with Russia and Putin’s positive response to negotiating the end of the Ukraine conflict, emphasizing Trump's leadership.

title: Microsoft CEO on Sachin and Bill Gates video: Looks like I found ...
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella showed interest in the new hybrid sport 'Crennis' after a playful video featuring Bill Gates and Sachin Tendulkar playing the game was shared. Combining cricket and tennis, the video highlighted their fun interaction and ended with them enjoying vada pav. The collaboration hints at future projects between the Sachin Tendulkar Foundation & Gates Foundation.

title: Supreme Court judges visit Manipur, Jairam Ramesh asks 'when will PM Modi go?'
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not visiting Manipur since violence erupted nearly two years ago, highlighting the need for a healing touch. He also questioned the delay in imposing President's rule despite constitutional collapse and criticised Home Minister Amit Shah's lack of response on the situation in Manipur.

title: JioHotStar makes 'IPL 2025 request' to Jio, Airtel and Voda as days of 'Free' IPL over
content: JioStar is planning to partner with telecom giants Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea to bundle IPL streaming subscriptions with their data plans for reaching over 1 billion viewers. This initiative aims to boost viewership and data consumption, crucial for JioStar's revenue targets, especially with IPL content behind a paywall.

title: Heathrow Airport 'open and fully operational' a day after fire shutdown
content: Heathrow Airport resumes full operations following a severe power outage caused by a fire at a nearby electrical substation, which led to the cancellation and diversion of 1,350 flights affecting around 200,000 passengers. The economic impact includes an estimated loss of £4.8 million per day in tourism revenue.

title: Big George and the legacy of big black men
content: George Foreman's journey from a heavyweight champion to a preacher and back to the boxing ring is highlighted. His determination to regain his title after a long hiatus and the challenges faced along the way are detailed, culminating in his eventual victory at 42 years old.

title: Musk-backed PAC offers voters $100 to sign petition against 'activist judges'
content: A PAC funded by Elon Musk is offering Wisconsin voters financial incentives to sign a petition opposing activist judges ahead of a key state Supreme Court election. The move aims to support the Republican-favored candidate, Brad Schimel, potentially impacting the judiciary's balance of power.

title: Elon Musk defends Ketamine use: It helps me, and that helps Tesla
content: Elon Musk discussed his use of ketamine for depression, highlighting its necessity for managing his mental health while maintaining his work ethic. He defended his late-night social media activity, asserted improvements in X's advertising revenue, and addressed content moderation policies. Musk's interview with Don Lemon led to the termination of Lemon's deal with X, reflecting tensions with traditional media.

title: Drunk cop tries to rape colleague inside thana in Mathura, arrested
content: A sub-inspector in UP Police was arrested for allegedly attempting to rape a 27-year-old Dalit female colleague inside a police station in Mathura. The officer, who was under the influence, forcefully entered her room during the early hours and attempted assault before being detained. Departmental proceedings will lead to his termination.

title: Forced to wear nightgown all day, woman files complaint in Ahmedabad
content: A 21-year-old woman from Juhapura has filed a complaint against her husband and in-laws for harassment, compelled clothing choices, and verbal abuse post-marriage. Her husband's alcohol habit and resulting abuse were supported by his parents, leading her to seek police intervention.

title: 'Invariable support': North Korea's Kim Jong Un backs Russia in Ukraine war
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un affirmed his support for Russia's war in Ukraine during a meeting with Russian official Sergei Shoigu. Kim pledged unwavering support for Russia's sovereignty and security, while Shoigu conveyed Russian President Vladimir Putin's greetings and commitment to their mutual defence treaty.

title: Transgender Danes told to consult US embassy before travel
content: Denmark's travel advisory page says transgender Danes should first consult the US embassy before traveling to the US. Finland issued a similar warning for its citizens last week in light of President Trump's policies.

title: Watch: George Foreman vs Muhammad Ali in epic ‘Rumble in the Jungle’ fight
content: Boxing legend George Foreman has died at 76. Remembered for his epic bouts with Muhammad Ali and his later business success with the George Foreman Grill, Foreman also made a remarkable comeback to regain the heavyweight title at age 45, securing his place in boxing history.

title: 'North will make us secondary citizens': Telangana CM Revanth Reddy
content: Chief ministers from various states gathered in Chennai to oppose the Centre's proposed delimitation of parliamentary seats. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin emphasized the potential legal battle, while Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan criticized the move as politically motivated. An expert panel for fair delimitation was proposed.

title: 'We pay premium fares, unacceptable': Supriya Sule slams Air India
content: NCP MP Supriya Sule criticises Air India's flight delays, urging the Civil Aviation Minister to act. Sule shared her own experience of a delayed flight, highlighting the impact on passengers. Separately, a Mohali consumer court fined Air India Rs 60,500 for delaying a refund and ordered compensation for a passenger.

title: Supreme Court judges reach Manipur to assess relief efforts
content: A Supreme Court delegation, led by Justice BR Gavai, has reached Manipur's Imphal to inspect relief camps amid ongoing ethnic violence. Their visit aims to assess and boost legal and humanitarian aid. Authorities are addressing a recent tragic incident involving the suspected rape and murder of a nine-year-old girl in a Churachandpur relief camp.

title: US ends legal status for 532,000 immigrants
content: The United States Department of Homeland Security has revoked legal safeguards for over 530,000 immigrants from these four countries who have been in the US since October 2022. The directive impacts those under the humanitarian parole program.

title: Israel's top court blocks dismissal of Shin Bet chief after removal by cabinet
content: Israel's High Court of Justice has temporarily blocked the removal of Ronen Bar, head of Israel's internal security agency Shin Bet, pending an appeal hearing. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's move to sack Bar has sparked widespread protests in Israel.

title: 'Will not be spared': Ajit Pawar threatens those intimidating Muslims
content: Maharashtra deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar has warned against attempts to intimidate the Muslim community or create communal discord, asserting they will face serious consequences. Speaking at an iftar party in Mumbai, Pawar emphasized unity and assured his support for the community, referencing the recent Nagpur violence amid protests against Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb.

title: As Hungary bans pride events, critics fear Russian influence
content: Neo-Nazis march in Budapest with impunity, while Hungary's government cracks down on LGBTQ+ representation, banning Pride parades and fining a bookstore for displaying LGBTQ+ content. Prime Minister Orban faces growing criticism for corruption, nepotism, and repression, with opposition leader Peter Magyar gaining popularity.

title: Viral: Rotten, fungus-grown strawberries cleaned and repackaged- Watch video
content: A viral video shows vendors repackaging rotten strawberries as fresh, posing serious health risks. Consuming these can lead to food poisoning, liver damage, respiratory issues, and fungal infections. These practices highlight a lack of oversight by food safety authorities. People are advised to avoid moldy strawberries and ensure they're consuming fresh produce to avoid health complications.

title: 'Did no wrong': Back home, strong support for US-based scholar facing deportation
content: Badar Khan Suri, an Indian scholar in the US, faces detention amid a crackdown on alleged Hamas supporters. His family and friends in India insist on his innocence, highlighting his research-focused life and lack of political involvement. Suri's situation raises concerns about the broader scrutiny of pro-Palestinian activism in the US.

title: Finding water-ice on Moon: Chandrayaan-3 unlocks some 'hot' secrets
content: Chandrayaan-3's Chandra's Surface Thermophysical Experiment (ChaSTE) achieved unprecedented in-situ temperature measurements at the Moon's south pole, revealing higher than expected surface temperatures. These findings are crucial for understanding lunar thermophysics and potential water-ice deposits, which are essential for human habitat and exploration. The research, bridging critical knowledge gaps, was published in Nature Communications Earth & Environment.

title: Watch: Dilip Ghosh threatens to 'choke' woman who confronted him
content: Dilip Ghosh threatened a woman protester who questioned his involvement in construction of a road in Kharagpur, even as the ex-BJP MP claimed he provided the funds for the road during his tenure as an MP. Local councillor Pradip Sarkar condemned Ghosh's behaviour, criticizing his aggressive and disrespectful remarks towards the women.

title: Boxing legend George Foreman dies at 76
content: Former heavyweight boxing champion George Foreman passed away at age 76. Known for his 1968 Olympic gold and world titles in 1973 and 1994, Foreman was famous for his bouts with Joe Frazier and Muhammad Ali. Beyond boxing, he gained fame for his grilling machine. He left behind a legacy in sports and business.

title: Nagpur violence: MDP president among fresh arrests by police; 10 minors held
content: Police in Nagpur have arrested 105 individuals, including 10 minors, after violence erupted due to rumors about the burning of a sacred 'chadar'. Special teams have been formed to identify more suspects, and primary instigator Fahim Khan has been charged with sedition and other offenses.

title: IPL 2025: Talking points and everything you need to know
content: The 18th edition of the IPL kicks off with significant changes, including seven new captains, updated rules like the return of saliva to shine the ball, and new coaching appointments. Notable captains include Rajat Patidar for RCB and Axar Patel for Delhi Capitals. There's heightened anticipation surrounding big-money signing Rishabh Pant at Lucknow Super Giants.

title: Anganwadi assistant brands child, sprinkles chilli powder in his diaper
content: An anganwadi assistant in Kanakapura town is accused of abusing a two-and-a-half-year-old boy by branding him and sprinkling chilli powder in his diaper. Although the boy's parents initially filed a complaint, they now seek to withdraw it, claiming it was based on false allegations and misunderstandings.

title: 'Innocent men don’t run from anything': Tates return to Romania
content: Andrew and Tristan Tate have returned to Romania to face charges of human trafficking and forming a criminal gang, asserting their innocence. The investigation is ongoing with additional charges including human trafficking and money laundering, although the brothers deny all allegations.

title: Mistaking acid for water, woman dies in Meerut following husband's death
content: A 78-year-old woman, Rajbala Devi, died in Achharonda village after accidentally consuming acid, mistaking it for water. She had been suffering from depression following her husband's death. The incident occurred on Thursday, and while no FIR has been filed, the police are investigating the presence of the acid bottle in her home.

title: Official lion count in Gujarat likely to hit 900 mark in 2025 census
content: The lion population in Gujarat is expected to reach between 900 and 1,500 in the 2025 census due to conservation efforts. The 2020 census recorded 674 lions, but informal estimates suggest much higher numbers. The lion territory has expanded by 36% in five years. Officials choose conservative reporting to account for factors like high cub mortality.

title: 'Left severed head in bathroom': New eerie details on merchant navy officer's murder
content: Police have uncovered chilling evidence in the brutal murder case of ex-merchant navy officer Saurabh Rajput in Meerut. Accused Muskan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla's involvement reveals occultism and manipulation. Following the crime, the duo hid the body and went on a holiday.

title: Another RJD poster targets Nitish Kumar as ‘khalnayak’ outside Lalu's residence
content: RJD workers have placed a poster outside former CM Rabri Devi's residence, portraying current Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as a villain for allegedly disrespecting women, Mahatma Gandhi, and the national anthem. The controversy follows an incident where Kumar was seen talking during the national anthem. Tejashwi Yadav criticized Kumar via social media as Bihar prepares for assembly elections.

title: 'Today will be etched in history': Stalin kicks off JAC meeting on delimitation
content: Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin initiated the first meeting of the Joint Action Committee to oppose the Centre’s proposed delimitation exercise. Stalin emphasized the importance of this event for safeguarding India's federal structure and warned about potential adverse effects on states' rights and parliamentary representation.

title: ‘Courtroom, not a cinema hall!': HC slaps fines on men who joined from bed and toilet
content: Two men faced penalties for casual disregard of courtroom decorum during virtual Gujarat high court hearings. Dhaval Patel was fined Rs 2 lakh and sentenced to two weeks of community service for joining from a lavatory, while Vamdev Gadhvi was fined Rs 25,000 for appearing while lying on his bed. Both actions compromised the court's dignity.

title: In MK Stalin's Delimitation Push, A "Sword Of Damocles" Warning From Ally
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin hosted the first meeting of the Joint Action Committee (JAC) on delimitation in Chennai today.

title: Judge In Cash Pile At Home Case Was Named in CBI's 2018 FIR
content: Justice Yashwant Varma, a sitting judge of the Delhi High Court, at whose residence a pile of unaccounted cash was allegedly discovered on March 14, was named in a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) FIR linked to a sugar mill bank fraud case.

title: Trump Was Asked If Sunita Williams Would Get Overtime Salary. His Response
content: Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who had been at the ISS since June 5 last year, were flown back to Earth early Wednesday in SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft.

title: Transparency, Freeze On Seats: Parties' 7-Point Resolution On Delimitation
content: The DMK-led Joint Action Committee (JAC), holding its first meeting today over the impending delimitation exercise proposed by the Union government, cited a lack of transparency and insufficient consultation with key stakeholders.

title: BJP MP's "Same Direction" Selfie With Shashi Tharoor. Congress MP Reacts
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's praises for his political rivals in Kerala had raised a storm within his party. But the former diplomat appears to have decided not to allow any speculation over his political life.

title: US Revokes Temporary Status Of 5 Lakh Migrants, To Face Deportation Soon
content: During his campaign, US President Donald Trump promised to deport millions of people who are in the US illegally.

title: Father Identifies Body With Crushed Head, Suspects In Jail, Then A Surprise
content: In an incident stranger than a movie script, a 35-year-old woman believed to have been murdered in 2023 has returned home, leaving his family and friends surprised.

title: KKR vs RCB Weather LIVE: Big Eden Gardens Update, "Patch Of Cloud But..."
content: Kolkata Weather LIVE Updates, KKR vs RCB, IPL 2025: The sun is shinning brightly in Kolkata as the fans take a sigh of relief.

title: Video: Journalist, Cab Driver Argue Over 95 Paise. Internet Sides With...
content: A video of a heated exchange between a woman journalist and a cab driver allegedly over 95 paise has gone viral. While the woman accused the driver of being rude to her, the latter alleged she threatened her, saying she was a journalist.

title: Iceland Minister Quits After Confessing To Having A Child With Teenage Boy
content: Iceland minister Asthildur Loa Thorsdottir got into a physical relationship with a 15-year-old more than three decades ago and gave birth to his child at the age of 23.

title: 'Never Said No Cash Found': Delhi Fire Chief's Clarification Amid Judge Row
content: Chief of Delhi Fire Services Atul Garg denied reports attributing to him a statement claiming that no cash was found during firefighting operations at the residence of Delhi High Court judge Justice Yashwant Varma.

title: Sudha Murty Reacts To Narayana Murthy's '70-Hour Work Week' Suggestion
content: Author-philanthropist Sudha Murty said she believes "time never becomes a limit" when people look forward to doing something seriously and passionately, reacting to a question about her husband's "70-hour work week" suggestion.

title: India's Advice To Students In US As Trump's Deportation Policy Gains Pace
content: The Indian government has asked its citizens studying in the US to comply with American laws after a researcher was arrested and another student had to self-deport to Canada.

title: "Never Hide Anything From Parents": Meerut Murder Accused Woman's Mother
content: Muskan confessed to killing her husband, revealing a gruesome plot that involved hiding his body in a drum and covering it with cement.

title: Mount St. Mary's HC Donny Lind and son reflect on tourney run
content: mount St. Mary's Mountaineers coach Donny Lind has had his son, Silas, with him for much of this season . the elder says he's enjoyed missing school, playing with his friends on the court . "it's been a blast to be able to bring him with me," he says .

title: Will the White Sox lose 120 games again? Could someone else lose more?
content: the Chicago White Sox are putting the finishing touches on an MLB record 121-loss 2024 season . they have traded away their best player in a winter move and added, well, not a whole lot in free agency . the white Sox have parted ways with a bunch of veterans they had in 2024 .

title: Jameis Winston signing sets up Giants' next -- and more significant -- QB move
content: jameis Winston is a notable name with a well-traveled résumé . he could have played his way into a starting job with the New Orleans Saints or Cleveland Browns . the Giants aren't committed to him long term, but they can move on after this season .

title: 'Publicity rather than delivery': Kharge attacks Centre over 'Make in India'
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics.

title: Joint Action Committee demands freeze on delimitation for another 25 years
content: DMK’s Parliamentary Party leader Kanimozhi, who briefed the media about a resolution passed by the JAC to this effect, said any delimitation exercise carried out by the Union government to improve the content and character of our democracy should be done transparently

title: Tamil Nadu was created by the British, not Tamilians: Maharashtra Governor Radhakrishnan
content: Maharashtra Governor was speaking at the launch of ‘Hedgewar - A Definitive Biography’ at Raj Bhavan in Mumbai.

title: Nagpur violence: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis dismisses claims of intelligence failure; says cost of damage will be recovered from rioters
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said 104 rioters have been identified after analysing videos and footage from CCTV cameras so far and action has been taken against 92 people, including 12 minors, as per the law

title: BJD opposes population-based criterion to determine States’ representation in Parliament
content: Odisha has done well, successfully reducing its fertility rates over the years and if projected population figures of 2026 are taken, the State will end up losing seats in the Lok Sabha and the State Assembly, says former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik

title: Reduction in Lok Sabha seats will disempower people in their own country: T.N. CM Stalin
content: Speaking at the first meeting of the Joint Action Committee to discuss the impact of delimitation, Mr. Stalin called for a fair delimitation exercise

title: National Prison Conference calls for urgent reforms, stresses need for psychologists in prisons
content: The Prison World Organisation, led by former DG of Telangana State Prisons V.K. Singh has been advocating for prisoner welfare both during incarceration and post-release.

title: Govt working for rehabilitation of Anantnag fire victims, says J&K minister
content: Ms. Itoo assured the house that the government is concerned and is working for proper rehabilitation of the fire victims as the sufferers are “very poor” people who have suffered immense losses due to the fire.

title: Kerala Governor objects to SFI banner against Savarkar on Calicut varsity campus
content: ‘Politicisation of the educational system and institutions should not be tolerated,’ says Kerala Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar at the University of Calicut at Tenhipalam

title: Construction of flyover near Sarna Sthal: Tribal outfits hit streets to enforce bandh in Jharkhand’s Ranchi; admin on alert
content: The Ranchi-Lohardaga road was blocked near Titla Chowk in Ranchi, while agitators gathered at the city's Kanke Chowk and other areas to impose the bandh

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu calls upon people to join Earth Hour
content: The Earth Hour’s coincidence with the World Water Day is a ‘meaningful overlap’ that highlights two essential pillars of life  -- energy and water conservation, Mr. Naidu said.

title: World Water Day: PM Modi says it is important to protect water for future generations
content: Water has been the lifeline of civilisations and thus it is more important to protect it for the future generations, says PM Modi

title: BJP MLA stages walkout from Jammu & Kashmir Assembly over government's 'non-serious' attitude
content: Sham Lal Sharma had raised a question about the dumping of solid waste at Kot Bhalwal village in his Jammu North constituency and asked for steps to shift the same to any alternate place

title: India strongly registered its concerns with U.S. authorities on treatment meted out to deportees, says Government
content: The MEA was asked whether the government has taken cognisance of reports about Indian deportees being shackled during their repatriation by the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement

title: Justice Unplugged: Law plays a fundamental role in shaping a transforming society, says G.V. Selvam
content: Suresh Nambath, Editor, The Hindu, urged some of the finest minds in India’s legal fraternity gathered at the Justice Unplugged: Shaping the Future of Law conclave to reflect on the future of law and justice in a world undergoing rapid change

title: Yati Narsinghanand booked for inflammatory, abusive remarks
content: Yati Narsinghanand Giri has been accused of making derogatory remarks against Mahatma Gandhi and using words intended to incite religious sentiments

title: Watch: Who is a citizen? | Varghese K George in conversation with Prof Niraja Gopal Jayal
content: Political scientist Niraja Gopal Jayal examines the evolving meaning of citizenship in India—its democratic implications, shifting interpretations, and the influence of global trends on national identity.

title: 'BCI got no business to go into legal education': SC paves way for two convicts to pursue LLB
content: A bench of Justices Surya Kant and N Kotiswar Singh made the remarks while dismissing a petition of Bar Council of India challenging a Kerala High Court order of November 23, 2023 which had allowed two men convicted for murder by the trial court to pursue LLB classes virtually

title: Stealth frigate launched into water at Goa Shipyard
content: In October 2016, India and Russia signed an Inter-Governmental Agreement for four additional follow-on stealth frigates under which two are to be manufactured by GSL under technology transfer

title: Lukewarm response for Bandh in North Karnataka
content: The call for Karnataka Bandh by Pro Kannada organisations for the Kannada cause evoked lukewarm response in the districtcs of Kalyana and Kittur Karnataka on Saturday.

title: HMDA to design master plan for redevelopment of area around Tank Bund in Hyderabad
content: The Buddha Purnima area includes several tourist destinations such as Lumbini Park, Laserium, Ambedkar’s Statue, Martyrs Memorial, NTR Garden, NTR Memorial, Sanjeevaiah Park, PV Gyanbhoomi, Necklace Road, Lakeview Park, People’s Plaza, wetland eco conservation zone and others.

title: Supriya Sule slams Air India over delayed flight; airlines cite operational issues
content: Supriya Sule said that her flight AI0508 was delayed by 1 hour and 19 minutes, noting the continuous trends of delays affecting passengers

title: Row over discovery of cash: Delhi High Court Chief Justice submits report to CJI
content: The Supreme Court said said the Delhi High Court chief justice had initiated an in-house inquiry against him and the proposal to transfer him to the Allahabad High Court was separate

title: Mixed response to Karnataka bandh in Mysuru in the initial phase
content: The impact of the bandh was more pronounced in the heart of the city as many shops and business establishments in and around K.R.Circle remained closed

title: ‘Justice Unplugged’, presented by VIT School of Law in association with The Hindu | Watch LIVE
content: Former Chief Justices of India N.V. Ramana and D.Y. Chandrachud are the chief guest and special guest respectively

title: Redevelopment works of Container Road nearing completion
content: Over 1,100 street lights being installed in the 17-km-long, accident-prone corridor; adequate number of reflectors too being installed, apart from concrete guide posts and metal crash barriers at embankments

title: Amid Aurangzeb tomb row, Ajit Pawar asks to resist divisive forces at Mumbai Iftar
content: NCP chief Ajit Pawar appealed to people to remain united, giving examples of how festivals such as Holi, Gudi Padwa, and Eid foster social cohesion

title: Five-member SC Judges delegation arrives in Manipur's Imphal
content: The delegation comprising Justices BR Gavai, Surya Kant, Vikram Nath, MM Sundresh, KV Viswanathan and N Kotishwar have arrived in Manipur and will visit relief camps

title: World Water Day: Water is life, but how much of it is actually fresh and accessible?
content: Did you know? About 71% of Earth’s surface is covered by water, but only 2.5–3% of it is freshwater. Most of this freshwater is frozen in ice caps (69%) or stored underground (30%), leaving less than 1.2% available in lakes, rivers, and swamps.

title: Heavy overnight rain and thunderstorms lash Hyderabad, trigger waterlogging
content: The heavy downpour caused severe waterlogging in multiple areas, leading to slow-moving traffic on Saturday morning

title: NSCN (I-M) junks Delhi’s alleged mining bid in Nagaland
content: The extremist group also accused the Centre of forming a coalition of rival groups to counterweight the Framework Agreement of August 2015.

title: Minorities Commission urges States to promote Gurmukhi
content: Chairman of National Commission for Minorities Iqbal Singh Lalpura writes to State governments also about preserving the history and cultural heritage of the Sikh community

title: Karnataka bandh LIVE updates: Mixed response to bandh in Mysuru, north Karnataka
content: Kannada organisations held bike rallies, marched in several parts of the State and appealed to the shopkeepers to cooperate and extend their support for the cause

title: Deocha Pachami locals take to Kolkata streets to protest against coal project
content: On February 6 this year, mining work started at the DPDH coal block to excavate basalt and consequently, the underground coal reserves. Although West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee promised a lucrative compensation package and emphasised that no land would be forcibly acquired, protests erupted in the area against anticipated evictions and environmental damage.

title: M.P. Minister announces cop’s suspension after Congress MLA’s emotional plea over ‘fake case’
content: Abhay Mishra, Opposition MLA from Semariya in Rewa district, alleged that the “false FIR” had been filed against him and his son Vibhuti Narayan Mishra in the Chorhata police station following a road accident in 2022 as he pleaded for action against the concerned police officers.

title: Bobbili Fort in Vizianagaram: Where memories of an iconic battle stay alive
content: A museum housed in Bobbili Fort in Vizianagaram commemorate a battle fought between two kingdoms in the region over 250 years ago, a conflict marked by bloodshed, revenge and colonial intrigue

title: Visakhapatnam - A city of military might and cultural splendour
content: Strategically located along the coast of Bay of Bengal, the port city is home to various military and cultural museums, showcasing the country’s proud naval history and the rich heritage of the Telugu people

title: Nagpur violence: 14 more held, number of arrests reaches 105; 3 fresh FIRs registered
content: Nagpur CP said the decision to lift the curfew from some parts of the city would be made after a high-level review meeting

title: Trinamool to skip delimitation meet in Chennai, to focus on voter IDs
content: Trinamool Congress feels the duplicate voter ID number issue is more important at present, as it may have an impact on the Assembly polls in Bihar, Kerala, Tamil Nadu and West Bengal.

title: Amid crackdown on farmers, SKM, BKU (U) skip talks in Punjab
content: ‘Create a conducive environment for talks, release those detained’; some other farmer leaders attend the meeting; SKM defers proposed march

title: Meerut murder case: Deceased’s kin allege involvement of ‘occult practices’
content: Saurabh Rajput was allegedly drugged and then stabbed to death by his wife and her lover on March 4, his body dismembered and sealed inside a drum with cement

title: Tulsi Gabbard's India visit highlights strong U.S.-India relationship: DNI
content: Ms. Gabbard also joined the Raisina Dialogue where she delivered keynote remarks on the collective effort to drive toward Mr. Trump's goals of a peaceful, free, secure, and prosperous society

title: Amit Shah takes 'kaala chashma' jibe at Rahul Gandhi
content: Mr. Shah said that whenever we see a terrorist, we shoot right between the eyes. Our government can neither tolerate terrorism nor terrorists

title: Hoping to rebuild ties with Canada: India
content: New Delhi's comments came days after Mark Carney took charge as Canada's new Prime Minister following the exit of Justin Trudeau from the top office.

title: Expert panel formed for construction of Shivaji memorial in Agra
content: ‘The place where Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj was kept under house arrest in the city of Agra will be acquired by the Maharashtra Government, and a grand memorial will be erected there’

title: Panic persists across Bangladesh as mob violence continues unabated
content: At least 27 were killed in mob attacks in January and February alone, compared with the 32 similar incidents recorded in the first seven months of 2024, just before the ouster of Sheikh Hasina; the interim govt. promises action regardless of the religion, beliefs, or affiliations of the perpetrators

title: Table-top exercise on counter-terrorism in Malaysia, field training exercise in India to be held in next two years
content: Earlier, the European Union convened a technical workshop on preventing and countering violent extremism in Delhi, on the sidelines of the Raisina Dialogue.

title: Parbhani violence: Probe holds police accountable for law student’s death, Congress demands action
content: Maharashtra Congress president H.V. Sapkal calls the BJP-led govt. ‘anti-Dalit’, accusing CM Fadnavis of mishandling the case; calls for further investigation

title: NHAI begins work on vehicle underpasses, flyovers to decongest Edappally Junction
content: Two 650-metre-long flyovers will be built atop the Edappally-Palarivattom bypass corridor and the Edappally-Varapuzha NH 66 corridor. The space beneath them will function as underpasses for vehicles to take a 180-degree turn

title: A riot in Nagpur over a long-dead emperor’s tomb
content: On March 17, tensions escalated in Nagpur when protesters demanding the demolition of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb’s tomb allegedly burnt a chadar. A mob attacked homes, set vehicles on fire, and went on a rampage. Abhinay Deshpande and Purnima Sah report on the controversy over an emperor who died more than 300 years ago, and trace how communal flames were fanned in Maharashtra

title: Rape bid and murder accused killed in police encounter in Lucknow
content: Ajay Dwivedi and his brother Dinesh had allegedly attempted rape on the woman and then strangled her in the Malihabad area of the capital on March 18

title: Officer’s attempt to heat blank bullets in frying pan triggers scare at Kochi police camp
content: The officer opted for an instant solution to dry up the blank bullets in view of the little time left before a police funeral ceremony.

title: Madras High Court had already upheld T.N. govt’s right to fix time, age and monetary limit for online games: Home Secretary
content: Counter affidavit filed in response to a batch of new writ petitions filed by online gaming companies challenging the TNOGA regulations

title: Preliminary exam for KAS posts: State Administrative Tribunal directs KPSC to refer unexamined questions to expert panel
content: The Tribunal said that the variation in translation would not be a ground for re-examination and interference with examination already conducted

title: Karnataka High Court orders handing over of custody of 16-year-old boy to parents from grandmother and paternal aunts
content: Acting on the ‘principle of best interest of the child’, the Bench pointed out that the dispute between boy’s parents and aunts had a detrimental effect on the minor child

title: 13 Bangladeshi nationals deported to their country, Centre tells Supreme Court
content: The verification process for the remaining illegal immigrants in detention centres in Assam is underway, says govt.

title: M.B Patil proposes land near BIAL for mega jewellery park
content: Despite global challenges like geopolitical uncertainties and tariff issues, India’s gem and jewellery sector has shown remarkable resilience, says GJEPC

title: Reconsider move to introduce CBSE in Maharashtra, says Supriya Sule
content: Ms. Sule questioned the implementation of the CBSE pattern, which ignores the existing education system in Maharashtra

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman Dhankhar speaks on judicial accountability, reminds MPs of NJAC Bill
content: Supreme Court clarifies Delhi HC judge judge transfer not linked to fire incident; Opposition raises concerns in Rajya Sabha

title: Nagarjuna Sagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve has 76 tigers, says annual report
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan releases the Annual Report and also unveils logo of Nagaravanams on the occasion of International Day of Forests

title: National Defence College team in A.P. for study tour
content: The team met with A.P. Chief Secretary and discussed the welfare programmes, Swarnandhra 2047 Vision Plan, and recently launched WhatsApp governance

title: Normal operations resume at NMDC as protesting workers return to work
content: NMDC resumes operations after worker protests, shares rise by 1.47% on BSE, aiming for 45 million tonnes production in FY25

title: As PM Modi’s Nagpur visit draws near, police focus on restoring normalcy in RSS hub
content: So far, 99 persons have been arrested and 13 cases booked; city court remands 17 more people to police custody on ‘serious’ charges; Central and State officials prepare to receive the Prime Minister on March 30; Maharashtra CM Fadnavis had termed the violence was a ‘planned incident’

title: A.P. to fill 948 anganwadi posts, boost to womens’ employment
content: The move aims to strengthen child welfare and boost job opportunities for women across 26 districts in the State.

title: Manipur is peaceful, dialogue between Kuki and Meitei communities initiated: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said he sincerely hoped that through dialogue the distance and division between the Kuki-Zo and the Meitei community would be bridged in the near future

title: Indian Navy carries out critical medical evacuation of merchant vessel crew off Goa
content: Two naval ships and a helicopter were involved in evacuating three crew members with severe burn injuries from the vessel, 230 nautical miles west of Goa; one more crew member died before the rescue

title: NCP factions withdraw complaints against Rajya Sabha members
content: Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar said based on the stand taken by leaders of both parties, he felt that it was “expedient to give quietness to both the petitions”

title: There is progress on GM food crops, says official
content: DBT Secretary Rajesh Gokhale’s remark comes amid apprehensions over the Environment Ministry’s approval for commercial cultivation of GM mustard in 2022; Supreme Court is scheduled to hear petitions next month

title: Chhattisgarh government announces special incentives for ‘Maoism free’ Panchayats
content: Under the scheme, a panchayat would have to facilitate the surrender of every resident of its constituent villages who had been involved in the activities

title: Wages in four tea gardens in north Bengal being delayed, admits Centre
content: Wages delayed in north Bengal tea gardens, protests over land allocation for tourism, highlighting laborers’ plight and demands

title: LaunchPad 2025: ‘Dare to Disrupt’ summit begins at BITS Pilani Hyderabad
content: BITS Pilani Hyderabad kicks off LaunchPad 2025, a 3-day summit fostering entrepreneurship with startups, investors, and industry leaders
